DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the action taken with study treatment as a result of the event.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Adverse Event Action Taken with Study Treatment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._An indication or description of an action taken in response to an adverse event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredName: Adverse Event Action Taken with Study Treatment

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Action Taken with Study Treatment Terminology Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology associated with the action taken with study treatment codelist of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM)._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that the administration of a medication was modified by reducing the rate at which the dose was given.

Concepts.definition: An indication that the administration of a medication was modified by reducing the rate at which the dose was given.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a medication schedule was continued without modification.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a medication schedule was continued without modification.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a medication schedule was modified by subtraction, either by changing the frequency, strength or amount.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a medication schedule was modified by subtraction, either by changing the frequency, strength or amount.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a medication schedule was modified through termination of a prescribed regimen of medication.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a medication schedule was modified through termination of a prescribed regimen of medication.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a medication schedule was modified by addition; either by changing the frequency, strength or amount.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a medication schedule was modified by addition; either by changing the frequency, strength or amount.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a medication schedule was modified by temporarily terminating a prescribed regimen of medication.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a medication schedule was modified by temporarily terminating a prescribed regimen of medication.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ReferenceDocuments.name: What action was taken with st

ReferenceDocuments.name: AEACN
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record changes made to the study treatment resulting from the adverse event.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Note
ReferenceDocuments.description: CDISC Controlled Terminology is used to indicate the action taken with the study treatment in response to the AE. How to handle multiple actions taken is sponsor-specific decision. If this information is collected elsewhere (i.e., on the Exposure CRF), then it is not required to be collected on the AE CRF. This variable is not to be used for actions taken with devices. See the SDTM Device IG for information on reporting multiple actions, or actions with multiple devices.
